title: Display a "citation" when hovering over links to other EIPs

labels.name: r-eips
labels.description: Relates to the formatting or another aspect of EIPs

body: @gcolvin suggested this in [EIPIP #61](https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/EIPIP/issues/161)
This would be good. I am thinking whether github-favored markdown support such feature or would we need to make a pull request for github-favored markdown  @SamWilsn @gcolvin
I think all we need to do is add the `title` attribute to the `<a>` tags, and that should work. Worst case, I could do something with popperjs.
There has been no activity on this issue for 1 week. It will be closed after 3 months of inactivity.
Still a nice to have.

I am fully in support!
There has been no activity on this issue for 1 week. It will be closed after 3 months of inactivity.
Would be nice. Waiting on the better preamble PR

GitHub supports a file called CITATION.cff that will generate bibtex/APA etc citations for you.

here is an example of usage for my Gas Reporting Index Survey — https://github.com/sambacha/gas-reporting/blob/master/CITATION.cff

Though this isnt exactly the requested feature your asking for, having at least a base would help 🤷‍♂️

The problem with the github CITATION file is that it can't be customized per-file. In addition, this is talking about including citations in EIPs, not to EIPs. The format for EIP citations is already well-established, and is included at the bottom.
